content:
I am a PhD student in Industrial & Systems Engineering Department at University of Washington. I am co-advised by Prof. Linda Boyle who leads Human Factors and Statistical Modeling (HFSM) Lab and Prof. Ashis Banerjee who leads Scale-independent Multimodal Automated Real Time Systems (SMARTS) Lab. Prior to studying at UW, I received my bachelor degree in Computer Science and Engineering from Shanghai Jiao Tong University.
Currently I’m working on Synergy: Augmented reality for control of reservation-based intersections with mixed autonomous-non autonomous flows funded by National Science Foundation (NSF) Cyber-Physical Systems (CPS). This work is collaborated with The University of Texas at Austin. I used to work on Enabling Real-Time Supply Chain Visibility Through Predictive Analytics funded by The Digital Manufacturing and Design Innovation Institute (DMDII).

title: Jundi Liu
